function.name: empty
function.short: This function makes it possible to use the dotted notation clifford.empty to create an empty array.

long.para: clifford.empty creates an empty multivector array. The size of the array may be specified using the same parameter profiles as in &matlab; and additionally the class of the empty components may be specified with a string parameter which must come last.

examples.precode:
>> x = clifford.empty
x = [] Cl(0,2) multivector
>> x = clifford.empty([1 0], 'int8')
x = Empty Cl(0,2) multivector matrix: 1-by-0
